revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2013}} {{Infobox aviator |name=Glen Dell |image= |image_size=200px |alt= |caption= |full_name=Glen Kennelly Dell |birth_date= {{Birth date|1962|4|9|df=y}} |birth_place= [[Johannesburg]], South Africa |death_date= {{Death date and age|2013|10|12|1962|4|9|df=y}} |death_place=[[Johannesburg]], South Africa |death_cause=Aircrash |resting_place= |resting_place_coordinates= |monuments= |nationality={{Flag icon|South Africa}} South Africa |spouse= |relatives= |first_race = 2008 |racing_best = 12th ([[2008 Red Bull Air Race World Series season|2008]]) |racing_aircraft = [[Zivko Edge 540]] |website= }} '''Glen Dell''' (9 April 1962 â€“ 12 October 2013) was a [[South Africa]]n commercial airline trainer and [[aerobatics]] pilot, who was qualified to race in the [[Red Bull Air Race World Championship]] in seasons [[2008_Red_Bull_Air_Race_World_Series_season|2008]] and [[2009_Red_Bull_Air_Race_World_Championship|2009]]. Dell's father was a [[World War II]] pilot, and he himself got his [[Private Pilot License]] around the year 1979. He then joined the [[South African Air Force]] to fly helicopters. After obtaining his [[Commercial Pilot License]], he joined [[South African Airways]] in 1994, where he became a Senior Training Captain.[http://www.fakr.co.za/press_releases.htm Krugersdorp Flying Club] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070112220311/http://www.fakr.co.za/press_releases.htm |date=12 January 2007 }}[http://www.glendellaerobatics.com Glen Dell Aerobatics - Passion for and Excellence in Aviation][http://www.slick360.com Slick Aircraft - The ultimate edge in aerobatic aircraft] Starting in 1985, he won the National Aerobatic Championships in various categories 12 times. He competed in the World Aerobatic Championships since 1994, and became Advanced World Aerobatic Champion in 2004.[http://www.air-races.com/pilots/Glen_Dell.htm Red Bull Air Races] Dell died in Sunninghill Hospital in Johannesburg suffering burns sustained when his aircraft, an [[Extra EA-330]] crashed on 12 October 2013 at the Secunda Airshow in [[Secunda, Mpumalanga|Secunda]], [[Mpumalanga]].{{cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Aerobatic-pilot-dies-after-show-crash-20131012 |title=Aerobatic pilot dies after show crash |publisher=News24 |date= |accessdate=2013-10-13}} ==Red Bull Air Races== He first flight dated 2008 in the [[2008 Red Bull Air Race World Series season|Red Bull Air Race World Series]]. {|class="wikitable" |- ! colspan="16" style="text-align:center;"|{{Flag icon|South Africa}} Glen Dell
